snippet: An Illinois judge sentenced Jack McCullough, 73, to serve the rest of his “natural life” in prison for the kidnapping and murder of Maria Ridulph on Dec. 3, 1957.
abstract: Illinois judge sentences 73-year-old Jack McCullough to serve rest of his 'natural life' in prison for kidnapping and murder of 7-year-old Maria Ridulph in 1957; prison term, under 1957 sentencing rules, carries possibility of parole after 20 years; McCullough has steadily maintained his innocence.
lead_paragraph: An Illinois judge sentenced Jack McCullough, 73, to serve the rest of his “natural life” in prison for the kidnapping and murder of Maria Ridulph on Dec. 3, 1957.

headline.seo: Maria Ridulph’s Killer Gets Life 55 Years After Her Death
headline.main: 55 Years After Girl’s Death, Her Killer Gets a Life Term
headline.print_headline: 55 Years After Girl’s Death, Her Killer Gets a Life Term
